title: Arya Stark's Reading List
body:
Arya Stark’s Reading List

“Leave one wolf alive and the sheep are never safe.”

Welcome to the newest installment in my Reading Lists Feature, a series of posts where I compose reading lists for and inspired by different characters. These are all books that I feel fit into the character’s aesthetic and personality, but also books I feel those characters would love to read. You can check the previous posts (Ronan Lynch,…

tags: its not often i compliment the show
but when i do its to compliment the actors
summary: What I really liked in the show was how Arya mourned Gendry. Like we haven’t seen her doing that when hotpie left or the Hound...
question: What I really liked in the show was how Arya mourned Gendry. Like we haven’t seen her doing that when hotpie left or the Hound or Jaqen. She was sad with hotpie but strong and moved on quickly. But with Gendry!! God her emotions were so intense. She was hurt and angry and sad and then they showed her mourning him. I mean everyone should get then that she has deeper feelings for Gendry, she was friends with the others but she was IN LOVE with Gendry which made it so hard for her to let him go
answer: YES! Her emotions were so palpable and Maisie did a phenomenal job with this because keep in mind that she’s displaying emotions that she herself (Arya) doesn’t fully understand yet. In the books, this is easier for the reader to grasp because we get it through her inner monologue in her POV chapters, but in the show it all has to come through the emotions displayed by the actress. Arya doesn’t have a comprehensive understanding of these complex emotions, she just FEELS THEM. Him leaving her feels like this ultimate betrayal after everything they’ve been through, and she doesn’t sit down and think ‘hmm, why does this hurt so much more than when Hot Pie left?’ she just feels the hurt, the anger, the sadness, the raw emotions that we all can relate to without necessarily articulating them.

reblog.comment: YES! Her emotions were so palpable and Maisie did a phenomenal job with this because keep in mind that she’s displaying emotions that she herself (Arya) doesn’t fully understand yet. In the books, this is easier for the reader to grasp because we get it through her inner monologue in her POV chapters, but in the show it all has to come through the emotions displayed by the actress. Arya doesn’t have a comprehensive understanding of these complex emotions, she just FEELS THEM. Him leaving her feels like this ultimate betrayal after everything they’ve been through, and she doesn’t sit down and think ‘hmm, why does this hurt so much more than when Hot Pie left?’ she just feels the hurt, the anger, the sadness, the raw emotions that we all can relate to without necessarily articulating them.

trail.content_raw: YES! Her emotions were so palpable and Maisie did a phenomenal job with this because keep in mind that she’s displaying emotions that she herself (Arya) doesn’t fully understand yet. In the books, this is easier for the reader to grasp because we get it through her inner monologue in her POV chapters, but in the show it all has to come through the emotions displayed by the actress. Arya doesn’t have a comprehensive understanding of these complex emotions, she just FEELS THEM. Him leaving her feels like this ultimate betrayal after everything they’ve been through, and she doesn’t sit down and think ‘hmm, why does this hurt so much more than when Hot Pie left?’ she just feels the hurt, the anger, the sadness, the raw emotions that we all can relate to without necessarily articulating them.
trail.content: YES! Her emotions were so palpable and Maisie did a phenomenal job with this because keep in mind that she’s displaying emotions that she herself (Arya) doesn’t fully understand yet. In the books, this is easier for the reader to grasp because we get it through her inner monologue in her POV chapters, but in the show it all has to come through the emotions displayed by the actress. Arya doesn’t have a comprehensive understanding of these complex emotions, she just FEELS THEM. Him leaving her feels like this ultimate betrayal after everything they’ve been through, and she doesn’t sit down and think ‘hmm, why does this hurt so much more than when Hot Pie left?’ she just feels the hurt, the anger, the sadness, the raw emotions that we all can relate to without necessarily articulating them.

summary: When she first meets Alerie Hightower Arya is less than impressed. She is kind, but it is obvious that she is not where Margaery...
caption:
When she first meets Alerie Hightower Arya is less than impressed. She is kind, but it is obvious that she is not where Margaery gets her cunning and it is just as clear that Alerie finds her somewhat lacking as a bride for her son. 

Then Father is killed. Arya spends the first week in silent rage, all the while convincing herself that direwolves do not cry and she would not show weakness in front of the Tyrells, even Willas. It works until a raven comes, a raven that Father sent before he was executed and had gotten delayed. Somewhere between Olenna’s solar and Arya’s own room she breaks. She remembers very little except for a loud wailing in her ears, then suddenly there are arms around her and someone telling her it was horrid, but all would be better eventually. She clings to Alerie Hightower for what feels like forever because right then Alerie reminded her of her own mother. 

Afterwards she spends more time with Alerie. She learns the woman and her good mother learns her. Arya still misses her mother something fierce, but she finds that she is grateful to have  Alerie Hightower as her good mother.

laura, 20s, germany.

question: Arya?
answer:
character: hate them | don’t really care | like them | LOVE them | THEY ARE MY PRECIOUS

ship with: Gendry

friendship them with: Daenerys, Jon, everyone on this fanart

general opinions: I think Arya’s one of the most misunderstood characters in the whole series. She’s such a multifaceted person with many emotions and cares so deeply for her loved ones. Yet a huge dumb as fuck part of the fandom continues to call her a ruthless killer, psychopath and other things. She’s one of my absolute faves and also reminds me a lot of my younger self. So, nothing but love for Arya Stark.

Thank you! :)

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary:
...He
finally caught both her wrists in one hand and started to tickle her with the other, so Arya slammed her
knee between his...
caption:
…He finally caught both her wrists in one hand and started to tickle her with the other, so Arya slammed her knee between his legs, and wrenched free. Both of them were covered in dirt, and one sleeve was torn on her stupid acorn dress. “I bet I don’t look so nicenow ,” she shouted.

I am Arya when I get a compliment. 

This was another request .

body:
Show Chapter | Archive of Our Own

Title: Love Works in Mysterious Ways

Fandom: Game of Thrones

Chapter: 8/?

Rating: Mature

Relationships: Jon Snow/ Sansa Stark, Gendry Waters/ Arya Stark

Characters: Jon Snow, Sansa Stark, Arya Stark, Gendry Waters, Bran Stark, Daenerys Targaryen, Tyrion Lannister, Jorah Mormont, Davos Seaworth, Lyanna Mormont, Alys Karstark, other northern lords, mentioned Rhaegar Targaryen, mentioned Lyanna Stark, mentioned Tormund Giantsbane, other Starks mentioned

Other tags: post-canon season 6, slight spoliers season 7, Emotional Hurt/Comfort, a little bit of angst, cousin incest, nightmares, forbidden love, Stark reunion, Arya x Gendry reunion, Dom/sub undertones

Part 2 of Mysterious Ways

Jon is falling for Sansa without knowing she hides feelings of her own. Arya returns and reunites not only with her family but also with Gendry. Two kinds of forbidden love grow in Winterfell and only Bran knows how it will all end.

blog.description: She/her, Jewish, feminist, movie buff, Bipolar II, spectator of Goyim insanity.

summary: Do you think Cat is a poor parent as well? (I  think she could/should have handled Mordane better.)
question: Do you think Cat is a poor parent as well? (I  think she could/should have handled Mordane better.)
answer:
Yes. But everyone already talks shit about Cat. This was about unpopular positions.

You know who also should have handled Mordane? Ned, who should have fired her ass after she passed out drunk in public when she should have been looking after her charge, the 11 year old future crown princess. Sansa was escorted home by a child murderer. Ned either did not notice or did not care.

Just like he did not care that his other daughter was running around alone in a dangerous, Lannister controlled city after said daughter was literally hunted through the woods by The Hound and Jaime Lannister over a dog bite.

blog.title: Asoiaf Rarepairs
blog.description:
Is your OTP overlooked by the fandom? Is there any pairing you wish you could find more content for? Do you like a good crackship? 
Have we got the blog for you!
All ships are welcome here, so long as they have fewer than 500 fics on AO3.
